name: Galerie Cazeau-Béraudière
directeurs: Philippe Cazeau & Jacques de la Béraudière
profile:
Because of their passion for Impressionism and Modern art, Philippe
Cazeau and Jacques de la Béraudière opened the Gallery
Cazeau-Béraudière, avenue Matignon, very close to the Champs Elysées.
Philippe Cazeau has headed up for 19 years the Wildenstein Institute and
Jacques de la Béraudière was international director at Sotheby’s London
during 10 years.
Since 1995, prestigious artists such as Monet, Renoir, Degas, Picasso,
Matisse, Modigliani, Chagall, Soutine, etc. have been exposed
continuously.
At the same time, promotion of the masters of the XXth century was
always one of their objectives. Defenders of the surrealists Max Ernst,
Yves Tanguy, André Masson, Philippe Cazeau and Jacques de la Béraudière
also organised exhibitions of Germaine Richier, Pierre Bonnard, Amedeo
Modigliani works.
The Cazeau-Béraudière gallery participates in the Biennale des
Antiquaires, TEFAF in Maastricht and the Armory Shows in New York, in
october and may.
